item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction is one of the few experiences where loneliness can be both confronted and relieved. Drugs, movies where stuff blows up, loud parties -- all these chase away loneliness by making me forget my name's Dave and I live in a one-by-one box of bone no other party can penetrate or know. Fiction, poetry, music, really deep serious sex, and, in various ways, religion -- these are the places (for me) where loneliness is countenanced, stared down, transfigured, treated." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction’s about what it is to be a fucking human being." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "We're all lonely for something we don't know we're lonely for. How else to explain the curious feeling that goes around feeling like missing somebody we've never even met?" -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Acceptance is usually more a matter of fatigue than anything else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Uma Thurman
item.description: "I still love the people I’ve loved, even if I cross the street to avoid them." -- Uma Thurman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Frederick Seidel
item.description: "Too much is almost enough" -- Frederick Seidel
